result.markdown:
--- title: "NATO Data" editor: visual --- ### interactive visuals: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(plotly) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Loading required package: ggplot2 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'plotly' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': last_plot ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following object is masked from 'package:stats': filter ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': layout ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Sample data for demonstration data <- data.frame( Category = c("A", "B", "C", "D"), Value = c(10, 15, 13, 17) ) # Plotly bar chart fig <- plot_ly(data, x = ~Category, y = ~Value, type = 'bar') fig ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Create a basic leaflet map library(leaflet) # Define custom icons nato_icon <- makeIcon( iconUrl = "https://maps.google.com/mapfiles/ms/icons/blue-dot.png", iconWidth = 32, iconHeight = 32 ) east_asia_icon <- makeIcon( iconUrl = "https://maps.google.com/mapfiles/ms/icons/red-dot.png", iconWidth = 32, iconHeight = 32 ) # Create the map leaflet() %>% addTiles() %>% setView(lng = 60, lat = 50, zoom = 3) %>% # NATO countries (example markers) addMarkers(lng = -0.1276, lat = 51.5074, popup = "London, United Kingdom (NATO)", icon = nato_icon) %>% addMarkers(lng = 2.3522, lat = 48.8566, popup = "Paris, France (NATO)", icon = nato_icon) %>% addMarkers(lng = 12.4964, lat = 41.9028, popup = "Rome, Italy (NATO)", icon = nato_icon) %>% # East Asian countries (example markers) addMarkers(lng = 139.6917, lat = 35.6895, popup = "Tokyo, Japan (East Asia)", icon = east_asia_icon) %>% addMarkers(lng = 126.9780, lat = 37.5665, popup = "Seoul, South Korea (East Asia)", icon = east_asia_icon) %>% addMarkers(lng = 121.4737, lat = 31.2304, popup = "Shanghai, China (East Asia)", icon = east_asia_icon) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: :::
